meanings.definition: A person who sells illegal alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The bootleggers were arrested for selling illegal alcohol.
meanings.sent2: Bootleggers were common during the Prohibition era.
meanings.sent3: The bootleggers tried to hide their illegal activities but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The bootleggers operated in the shadows, like modern-day outlaws.
meanings.sent5: The image of bootleggers sneaking around with bottles of moonshine is iconic.

meanings.definition: To engage in the illegal sale of alcohol.
meanings.sent1: They decided to bootleggers alcohol to make quick money.
meanings.sent2: Bootleggers often faced harsh penalties for their actions.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly planned to bootleggers at the next party.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was bootleggers her way through the underground market.
meanings.sent5: The idea to bootleggers alcohol seemed risky but exciting at the same time.
